doc.title: Ambarella
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Edge AI strength continues but auto softness keeps us at NeutralEdge AI strength continues but auto softness keeps us at_2025-08-28

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: NEUTRAL | PO: 90.00 USD | Price: 70.63 USD

AMBA delivered a strong beat/raise in its 2Q (Jul'Q) print driven by continued edge- AI strength with loT up high teens sequentially to \(77\%\) of total revenue. Notably, AMBA raised its FY26E (CY25E) guidance by \(+9\%\) to a midpoint of \(\) 379m\(after a 5\%\) hike in 1Q. Ambarella have secured a high- volume autonomous aerial drone design win with HK- based Insta360, expected to be 10s of \$mns over the product's lifetime at a triple- digit ASP and potentially leading to a roadmap from the customer in time. AMBA sees a SAM in aerial robotics of \(\) 125m\(in this FY approaching\) \ \(500m\) in next 5Y with high- volume shipments into the robotics market expected by the end of the year and strong growth expected as more autonomy is introduced. AMBA continues to benefit from the rapid growth of edge AI, \((80\%)\) of total revenue this year) within a greater \(\) 5bn\(edge AI SAM growing\) 18\% \(CAGR to\) \ \(12.9bn\) by 2030 across auto and loT. However, auto has remained soft \((- 6\%)\) QoQ in 2Q) with AMBA still without a ADAS \(L2+\) (or higher) significant design win and auto not expected to outperform loT until 2027- 28. Increasing exposure to more volatile loT/consumer may heighten seasonality (4Q implied be down - 10% QoQ) and dampen I- t growth where we expect tople to decelerate from \(+33\%\) YoY in FY26E to \(+8\%\) YoY in FY27E given total auto/loT market expected to grow only - 5%. All in, we raise FY26/27E sales \(+9\% / + 6\%\) and raise our PO to \(\) 90\(from\) \ \(63\) on 9x EV/S (6x prior), near the middle of AMBA's historical 4- 19x trading range. We reiterate Neutral given emerging edge AI opportunity offset by persisting auto softness.

AMBA's edge- AI pipeline remains intact with 2nm projects still expected to begin production in 2027. Design win in fast growing aerial drone market will allow for faster revenue amidst more fragmented robotics market. Per media reports, AMBA remains a candidate for acquisition by a larger diversified vendor looking to expand into edge- AI.

loT, now \(77\%\) of revenues, is currently margin dilutive with GM pressure combined with muted sales outlook capping FY27E EPS growth at just \(2\%\) . AMBA continues to increase its exposure to more volatile, ex- growth consumer market with smaller size vs competitors, potentially limiting design win reach at major Auto programs already seeing sluggishness.

Our price objective of \(\) 90\(is based on 9x CY26E EV/S, near the middle of historical 4x - 19x trading range. We assign AMBA a multiple that is at a middle of the range based on the company's long - term growth potential in edge Al offset by near - term auto sluggishness and topline uncertainty amidst lack of significant design wins.
Upside risks to our PO: Faster penetration of CV chip technology in focus automotive/security markets, and semiconductor industry consolidation.

Downside risks to our PO: US- China trade tensions which could negatively impact security camera market sales, semiconductor cyclicality, further deterioration in legacy consumer businesses, failure to successfully penetrate target auto/security markets with new computer vision chip roadmap and excess inventory.
